author: Listin Diario
title: Fuertes lluvias este fin de semana
text: una vaguada Fuertes lluvias este fin de semana El territorio nacional permanecer√° bajo un ambiente h√∫medo e inestable y la vaguada seguir√° incidiendo en regiones del pa√≠s. El Instituto Dominicano de Meteorolog√≠a (Indomet) indic√≥ que este s√°bado una zona de baja presi√≥n se estar√° ubicando sobre el territorio nacional y junto a una vaguada en varios niveles de la troposfera, favorecer√° la ocurrencia de aguaceros desde horas de la ma√±ana. Indomet inform√≥ que se esperan fuertes lluvias, tronadas y r√°fagas de viento sobre las provincias: San Crist√≥bal, Duarte, S√°nchez Ram√≠rez, La Vega, San Jos√© de Ocoa, Espaillat, Hermanas Mirabal, Santiago, Monse√±or Nouel, Santiago Rodr√≠guez, San Juan, El√≠as Pi√±a y el Gran Santo Domingo. Asimismo, sostuvo que al suroeste del mar Caribe existe una zona con 70% de probabilidad de desarrollo cicl√≥nico durante los pr√≥ximos siete d√≠as, por lo que este disturbio tropical podr√≠a incrementarse a una depresi√≥n tropical el pr√≥ximo fin de semana. La entidad recomend√≥ a los operadores de fr√°giles, peque√±as y medianas embarcaciones, a permanecer en puerto, debido a vientos anormales y olas de 7 a 9 pies cerca de la costa, siendo superiores mar a dentro. Adem√°s, alert√≥ que las zonas costeras bajas de la regi√≥n Norte del pa√≠s, ‚Äúdeben estar atentos por posibles inundaciones costeras‚Äù. En tanto que el Centro de Operaciones de Emergencias (COE) mantuvo la alerta amarilla en nueve provincias y otras cuatro junto al Distrito Nacional en verde. En alerta amarrilla est√°n: Puerto Plata, Mar√≠a Trinidad S√°nchez, Espaillat, Hato Mayor, El Seibo, Saman√°, Duarte, Hermanas Mirabal, La Altagracia. Mientras que en alerta verde Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, La Vega, Monte Cristi y Santiago. la costa norte En la costa Atl√°ntica, el Indomet recomend√≥ a los operadores de fr√°giles, peque√±as y medianas embarcaciones permanecer en puerto, debido al viento moderado con ocasionales r√°fagas y olas de 7 a 9 pies cerca la costa, siendo superiores mar adentro. ‚ÄúEn las zonas costeras bajas de la costa norte, deben estar atentos por posibles inundaciones costeras‚Äù, indic√≥ el organismo. Durante la noche, se pronostica la continuaci√≥n de las lluvias hacia provincias cercanas al litoral Atl√°ntico. Se esperan lluvias para las pr√≥ximas 24 a 72 horas en regiones del pa√≠s. Clima Para ma√±ana y el lunes, la vaguada en superficie estar√° movi√©ndose cerca de la porci√≥n oriental de Cuba, induciendo as√≠ un viento c√°lido y h√∫medo del sur que arrastrar√° bastante humedad, indica Meteorolog√≠a.

author: @ilmanifesto
title: Omicidio di un giornalista egiziano: il fratello accusa Kiev | il manifesto
text: Omicidio di un giornalista egiziano: il fratello accusa Kiev Assassinato il giornalista egiziano Mohammed Al-Alawi, autore di un‚Äôinchiesta su propriet√† di lusso sulla costa del mar Rosso, facenti capo alla famiglia del presidente ucraino Volodymyr Zelensky. La polizia egiziana, che non si √® ancora espressa sui moventi dell‚Äôomicidio, ha reso noto che il corpo di Al-Alawi, ritrovato in una via periferica della citt√† turistica di Hurghada, presenta numerose abrasioni, fratture e che la morte √® stata causata da un grave trauma cranico. GIOVANE desideroso di affermarsi nella professione, lo scorso agosto, Al-Alawi aveva reso pubblici documenti che provavano l‚Äôacquisto a nome della suocera di Zelensky, Olga Kijashko, di una lussuosa villa nella localit√† privata di El Gouna, anche conosciuta come ‚Äúla Venezia egiziana‚Äù. Si tratta di un immobile di 300 mq, con vista mare, del valore di 4,8 milioni di dollari e la cui data di acquisto √® il 16 maggio 2023, coincidente con l‚Äôinizio della controffensiva ucraina. L‚Äôinchiesta ha avuto risonanza in tutto il mondo, facendo riemergere una verit√† scomoda: quella della corruzione endemica che attanaglia i vertici del potere ucraino. √à anche grazie a materiali di questo tipo che va scemando il consenso al supporto incondizionato a Kiev. Questa settimana, il ministro delle Finanze tedesco Christian Lindner ha dichiarato che la Germania ¬´non vede alcun motivo per aumentare l‚Äôassistenza militare e finanziaria all‚ÄôUcraina¬ª. Commentando l‚Äôassassinio del fratello per una pubblicazione egiziana, Ahmed Al-Alawi ha detto che se il reportage aveva portato a Mohammad popolarit√†, il reporter aveva anche iniziato a ricevere intimidazioni e minacce. Ahmed ha anche detto che, secondo la polizia, l‚Äôomicidio potrebbe essere legato ad un‚Äôazione dei servizi speciali ucraini e che indagini sono in corso sul possibile coinvolgimento di diversi cittadini ucraini residenti in Egitto. L‚ÄôENTIT√Ä delle violenze subite da Mohammed Al-Alawi √® coerente con l‚Äôipotesi di tortura. Secondo una tale ipotesi, per ora non suffragata da nessuna prova, i servizi segreti di Kiev potrebbero aver rapito il giornalista per torturarlo e scoprire le fonti delle sue informazioni. L‚ÄôEgitto √® divenuto infatti un luogo rifugio per i capitali della cerchia ristretta del potere ucraino il quale terrebbe a premurarsi che una simile fuga di notizie non si verifichi pi√π. Nel caso la pista ucraina venisse confermata, resta da vedere quale sar√† la reazione del governo egiziano. Il Cairo ha cercato di mantenere una posizione neutrale nel conflitto russo-ucraino ma proseguire su tale linea √® divenuto difficile di fronte al sostegno attivo di Zelensky ai bombardamenti della Striscia di Gaza. Potenzialmente, l‚Äôepisodio potrebbe contribuire a rafforzare ulteriormente il fronte dei paesi del Sud del mondo e ad aumentare il boicottaggio dell‚ÄôUcraina di Zelensky.

author: MOHD RASFAN
title: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif celebrates winning gold at the 2024 Olympics in Paris | National | tylerpaper.com
text:
Algerian boxer Imane Khelif celebrates winning gold at the 2024 Olympics in Paris
- MOHD RASFAN
- Updated
Tags
As featured on
Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif, at the centre of a gender row at the Paris Games, is targeting a second gold in Los Angeles and says she will not be intimidated by Donald Trump.

author: globo.com
title: Na √çndia, IPO da Hyundai encontra estrada sinuosa | Neg√≥cios | pipelinevalor
text:
N√£o basta estar em um mercado com liquidez para garantir um IPO de sucesso. √â preciso tamb√©m que a tese brilhe os olhos do investidor. Foi o que faltou em Nova York para a Moove, empresa brasileira que acabou suspendendo os planos, e mais recentemente para a sul-coreana Hyundai, que nesta semana teve uma estreia frustrante da sua subsidi√°ria na √çndia, bolsa que tem despontado como uma das mais aquecidas do mundo, e no ano passado superou os Estados Unidos em listagens.
N√£o se pode dizer, √© verdade, que o IPO da Hyundai indiana n√£o teve um boa capta√ß√£o. Com US$ 3,3 bilh√µes levantados, a empresa protagonizou a maior oferta p√∫blica da hist√≥ria do pa√≠s. No entanto, a a√ß√£o caiu 7% em seu primeiro dia de negocia√ß√£o. Desde ent√£o, chegou a recuperar parte das perdas, mas ainda acumula recuo de quase 2% - e as cr√≠ticas aumentaram.
Continuar lendo Moove posterga IPO em NY NY processa Hyundai e Kia ap√≥s viral no TikTok estimular furtos
O dinheiro levantado na listagem est√° sendo devolvido √† controladora coreana da Hyundai e os investidores ficaram com a impress√£o de que a Hyundai n√£o precisava de recursos, s√≥ queria aproveitar a festa indiana. A matriz decidiu aumentar as taxas de royalties que cobra da subsidi√°ria, agora de 3,5% da receita total. Os analistas da Emkay afirmaram que ‚Äúroyalties mais elevados e rendimentos de tesouraria mais baixos provavelmente restringir√£o o crescimento do lucro por a√ß√£o."
Montadora sul-coreana aumentou taxa de royalties que cobra da √≠ndia ‚Äî Foto: Hyundai No after market, Tesla ganha uma Petrobras inteira
No caso da Moove, fabricante e distribuidora de lubrificantes controlada pela Cosan , o IPO estava marcado para ocorrer no in√≠cio de outubro em Nova York, onde as perspectivas para o mercado de a√ß√µes t√™m se mostrado mais favor√°veis, mas foi cancelado no dia da listagem. N√£o colou a tese que a companhia tentou emplacar que √© mais multinacional que brasileira, j√° que dois ter√ßos do Ebitda da Moove ainda est√£o no Brasil. Com o risco-Brasil, o investidor estrangeiro queria exposi√ß√£o pequena e a companhia n√£o conseguiu uma boa composi√ß√£o de fundos de longo prazo na demanda.
Mais recente Pr√≥xima D√≥lar pode subir ainda mais em governo Trump, diz Goldman Sachs

author: PA News Agency
title: Off-road drivers were swept away by river, says man who tried to save them | The Mail
text: A man who tried to save three men trapped in a submerged 4√ó4 vehicle said they were ‚Äúswept away‚Äù as they attempted to cross a river. Emergency services including police, ambulance and a helicopter attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday. A 4√ó4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside had died, North Yorkshire Police said. Chris Ford, who lives nearby, told the PA news agency the men were part of an off-roading group when they crossed a ford on Rake Lane. The river, swollen by heavy rain, swept them away and carried them around 400 yards downstream, he said. It came as Storm Gerrit caused flooding and travel chaos across the country throughout Wednesday and Thursday. Mr Ford, a firewood salesman, was called to the scene to help recover the vehicle with his tractor and found it fully submerged beneath the water, he said. He and two others used tractors to pull the 4√ó4 on to the riverbank, he said. Police said another man, who attempted to help those trapped in the car, was pulled from the river and needed medical treatment. Mr Ford told PA: ‚ÄúThere was a ford they were going over and they were swept down 400 yards. ‚ÄúThey were part of an off-road club. ‚ÄúI went down with my tractor. There was a couple of vehicles ‚Äì one parked up. ‚ÄúYou couldn‚Äôt see the (other) vehicle. It was 3ft beneath the water. ‚ÄúI helped get it out on to the riverbank with three other tractors.‚Äù Two other locals, Rosie and Andrew Dale, said they were with Mr Ford when he got the call to help. They said they saw several 4√ó4 vehicles pass their home in the direction of the ford shortly before the incident. Mrs Dale said ‚Äúnobody local‚Äù would attempt to cross the ford in the current conditions. The area is popular with 4√ó4 drivers, she said, adding: ‚ÄúIn the summer you get 10 of them at a time.‚Äù A spokesperson for North Yorkshire Police said: ‚ÄúLocalised conditions across our area are making driving hazardous. ‚ÄúRoads are particularly badly affected around the River Esk, to the north of the county, as we have seen with the tragic incident near Glaisdale. ‚ÄúThere was another incident at nearby Houlsyke at 12.49pm when a car got stuck in flood water and another at Kirby Wiske in Hambleton at 2.35pm. ‚ÄúThankfully, the occupants of both vehicles were brought to safety. ‚ÄúThe key advice is to consider whether your journey is necessary. ‚ÄúPlease avoid driving through any kind of standing or moving flood water if you possibly can.‚Äù Witnesses to the incident at Glaisdale are urged to call North Yorkshire Police on 101, option 4, quoting reference NYP-28122023-0146. author: @BnkInfoSecurity
title: US Water Cybersecurity Improvement Efforts at Loggerheads
text: Cyber threats against the U.S. water sector are growing but the main federal regulatory agency that oversees it may be stymied by a lack of cooperation from sector operators, concludes a Government Accountability Office report. See Also: From Ancient Myths to Modern Threats: Securing the Transition from Legacy to Leading Edge Water sector associations and water system operators don't want to collect cybersecurity performance metrics, Environmental Protection Agency officials told the GAO. "These officials said in December 2023 that the agency therefore had no viable route to acquire data and develop water-specific performance metrics," the congressional watchdog [said]( https://www.gao.gov/assets/gao-24-106744.pdf) in a Thursday report. Politically motivated and ransomware attacks alike against the water sector have mounted steadily (see: [Iranian Hacking Group Attacks Pennsylvania Water authority](/iranian-hacking-group-attacks-pennsylvania-water-authority-a-23708)). Even if not large in number - the GAO said there were five known attacks against water and wastewater systems that occurred from 2019 through 2021 - such attacks hold the potential to damage public health and cause cascading effects on other sectors dependent on a functional water system. Known attacks include three ransomware attacks in 2021 against water systems in California, Maine and Nevada that affected utility SCADA servers. The EPA backed down in 2023 an attempt to make cybersecurity a component of federally mandated safety assessments of water systems after federal judges ordered the Environmental Protection Agency to halt those efforts (see: [US EPA Nixes Cybersecurity Assessments of Water Systems](/us-epa-nixes-cybersecurity-assessments-water-systems-a-23328)). The agency invoked powers earlier this year under the Safe Drinking Water Act to make the security of operational technology a factor in periodic assessments, which the agency calls "sanitary surveys." A federal judge in a lawsuit brought by rom the attorneys general of Missouri, Arkansas and Iowa, as well as industry lobbying groups American Water Works Association and the National Rural Water Association, stayed the EPA order. The EPA has [said](/epa-cracks-down-on-us-water-systems-cybersecurity-violations-a-25295 ) it still "intends to use enforcement authorities to address problems quickly," but the GAO said that the EPA never provided documentation of which statutory authorities it can invoke to force water systems into improving cybersecurity. Water system operators and cybersecurity experts say sector resistance to cybersecurity mandates doesn't come from ignorance of the risk, but from lack of funding. "State and local agencies are chronically tight on funding, and cybersecurity is a line item - an expensive line item - that wasn't on most agency budgets a few years ago," said Sean Deuby, principal technologist for the threat mitigation platform Semperis, told Information Security Media Group earlier this year (see: [Water Sector Lacks Support to Meet White House Cyber Demands](/water-sector-lacks-support-to-meet-white-house-cyber-demands-a-24669)).

organizations.name: us water cybersecurity improvement efforts at loggerheads us water cybersecurity improvement efforts
